response.answer_text: I gave Anthe that year. That exam was a bit tough as I was unable to answer some of the questions. I was only expecting to get a maximum of 80% scholarship because of bad performance. Then, the result day came, I didn’t check my result on the night, it was released as I was determined that I wouldn’t get that much scholarship which will make my expenditure at Aakash feasible. So, I checked it on next morning, I was amazed because I saw “ 100% scholarship on both tuition and technology fee. I was suspicious about my result then. I thought that it is a technical error and would have been showing a 100% scholarship to everybody. That day, when I asked about this result from my school friends, they got less scholarship than me. I then realized, “ Hey boy! you have really got that result.” What was left then? I took admission to Aakash Preet Vihar Branch which gave the NEET and AIIMS 2019 topper (I think you know his name). One thing I would say to you is that in these types of competitive exams, your performance don’t matter, your relative performance matter. A paper that is tough for you, would be tough for everybody.
